snippet: Bishop Robert W. Finn was sentenced to two years of court-supervised probation for failing to report suspected child abuse.
abstract: Robert W Finn, a Roman Catholic bishop in Kansas City, Mo, is found guilty of failing to report suspected child abuse, becoming the first American bishop in the decades-long sexual abuse scandal to be convicted of shielding a pedophile priest; verdict is a watershed moment in scandal that has plagued the church since the 1980s; case serves as a wake-up call to Catholics that extensive protection policies cannot be effective if the bishops do not follow them.

byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and LAURIE GOODSTEIN
byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Kansas City, Mo., and Laurie Goodstein from New York.

lead_paragraph: Bishop Robert W. Finn was sentenced to two years of court-supervised probation for failing to report suspected child abuse.
